decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing/document title number(s):
ART/2023/FFRE416/EE; ART/2023/FFRE416/PE REVB; ART/2023/FFRE416/ELPL REV B; ART/2023/FFRE416/SM REV B; ART/2023/FFRE416/FE REVB;
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | As shown on the approved plans as listed under condition 2, the proposed first floor side elevation window shall be obscure glazed and non-opening for a height of 1.7m as measured from finished floor level.
Reason: To ensure the privacy of neighbouring properties would be unduly impacted in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: First floor rear extension; installation of one window to side elevation
